citations.desc: ACCESS AND INSPECTION OF RECORDS AND PROPERTY; SUBMISSION OF ITINERARIES.
citations.narrative:
Availability of Records.
***At the time of the inspection, the camel handler could not produce any of the documents and records that are
required under the AWA Regulations and was unfamiliar with these documents (specifically the written Program of
Veterinary Care and acquisition records for the camels that were in travel status at this location). The handler made
several attempts to contact his boss for guidance but he could not be reached. As a result, none of the required
documents and records that must be available at the time of an inspection could be reviewed.
Per this Section of the Regulations, all documents and records that are required to be kept under the AWA should
be available at the time of an inspection so the required records can be reviewed to determine the facility's
compliance with the provisions of the AWA. All licensees that are in travel status are required to carry copies of all
of the required documents while on the road so the documents can be made available for review at the time of an
inspection.
The travelling unit of the licensee that is at the RI zoo needs to have copies of all the required documents.
Correct by 8/20/17.

citations.desc: ACCESS AND INSPECTION OF RECORDS AND PROPERTY; SUBMISSION OF ITINERARIES.
citations.narrative:
Submission of Itineraries.
***There are no itineraries from the Licensee currently on file at the Fort Collins Office of Animal Care with the
details for all locations of the Licensees’ animals that are currently in or will be in travel status. The inspector
contacted the Office and the home inspector to check if there was a current itinerary and verified that there was no
itinerary on file. The Licensee has been in travel status at the RI zoo since the end of May 2017 and will remain
there until the beginning of September 2017. In addition according to an inspection report on file dated 8/10/17,
there are also 3 of the Licensee's camels in MN.
Per this Section of the Regulations, any person who is subject to the Animal Welfare regulations and who intends to
exhibit any animal at any location other than the person's approved site shall submit a written itinerary that shall be
received by the AC Regional Director no fewer than 2 days in advance of any travel. The itinerary shall contain
complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any location
other than the person's approved site and shall include the names, dates, and locations (with addresses) where the
animals will travel, be housed, and be exhibited, including all anticipated dates and locations (with addresses) for
any stops and layovers that allow or require removal of the animals from the transport enclosures.
The itinerary must also include the name of the person who intends to exhibit the animal and transport the animal
for exhibition purposes, including any business name and current Act license or registration number and, in the
event that any animal is leased, borrowed, loaned, or under some similar arrangement, the name of the person who
owns such animal; and the name, identification number or identifying characteristics, species (common or scientific
name), sex and age of each animal that will be in travel status.
Complete and accurate information concerning the whereabouts of the animals when a licensee is in travel status is
necessary in order to know the location of the licensee to ensure that inspections can be conducted when required
in order to determine compliance with the provisions of the AWA and to assess the facility and animals.
The licensee needs to submit an itinerary to the Fort Collins Office that contains complete and accurate information
as outlined in all of Section 2.126 (c) (1) concerning the identification of all animals and locations while in travel
status.
Correct by 8/18/17.
NOTE - Inspection conducted at the Roger Williams Park Zoo in Providence, RI. Inspection and exit briefing held
on-site with Camel Handler. Report delivered by e-mail 8/11/17.
